result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy P. Hack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or a combination of the two, or if not then must  perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with S.B. unless authorized by the dept.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
81 days credit if revoked.
Court authorized early discharge from probation after 1 year if the dept deems it appropriate and the defendant has completed all conditions.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

COURT notes order of the court authorized early discharge after 1 year if deemed appropriate by the dept and deft completed all conditions.

State notes probation agent has indicated deft has not met all conditions at this times. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT denies request.

Case Called: 10:15 am 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Peter Karoblis.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to:
Ct. 1 (Stalking)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 2 (Battery)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
Ct. 3 (Criminal Trespass to Dwelling)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct. 4 (DC)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 18 months probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; no contact with S.B. unless authorized by the dept; payment or court costs. 
COURT finds the def entitled to 81 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT authorizes early discharge from probation after 1 year if the dept deems it appropriate and def has completed all conditions.
